title: Under the bombs, famine looms in Gaza
summary: According to the World Food Program, 93% of Gazans are now in 'acute food insecurity.' On Friday, a United Nations Security Council resolution called for the delivery of humanitarian aid to the enclave 'at scale.'

title: America's Trump dilemma
summary: The former president of the United States was disqualified from the Colorado primary for his role in the 2021 Capitol insurrection. In his time at the White House, he flouted all democratic rules. But the legal proceedings against him have strengthened his stature in his base's eyes.

title: Putin's fantasy Russia can be found in Moscow's VDNKh park
summary: This immense green space hosts an exhibition celebrating Russian heritage and achievements in the country's regions, including those annexed from Ukraine. It is supposed to accompany the 2024 presidential campaign.

title: Yemen warring parties agree to ceasefire, says UN
summary: The United Nations envoy for Yemen said the Saudi-backed presidential council and Iran-backed Houthi rebels agreed to engage in a UN-led peace process to end the war.

title: 'On immigration as on Depardieu, Culture Minister Abdul Malak stands against Macron and much of public opinion'
summary: Hurt by the measures in the immigration law and disavowed by the president on her condemnation of the rape-accused actor, Rima Abdul Malak has decided to remain in office to fight against the far right, observes Le Monde's culture columnist Michel Guerrin.

title: A cheap menu for Christmas
summary: Here are three chic and anti-waste recipes to please your guests on a budget.

title: Two people in custody after France grounds plane carrying 300 Indians over suspected 'human trafficking'
summary: Special investigators are questioning all those aboard, the Paris prosecutor’s office said in a statement. Thirteen unaccompanied minors were aboard.

title: Czechs hold national day of mourning for Prague shooting victims
summary: The Czech Republic held a minute of silence for the 14 victims of the shooting at Charles University, as well as the shooter's father and two other people he appears to have killed days earlier.

title: The Fed turns 110: A slow rise to power
summary: After decades of tensions between states and banking crises, the United States created the Federal Reserve on December 23, 1913. Today, it is the world's most influential financial institution.

title: Russia bars pro-peace candidate from presidential ballot
summary: After her independent bid was rejected, Yekaterina Duntsova urged the liberal party Yabloko to nominate her as its candidate. Though she said she has illusions about Vladimir Putin's re-election, she said 'you must not do nothing.'

title: Russian Communists name veteran to run against Putin
summary: Nikolai Kharitonov was the only candidate to represent the party in the March 2024 presidential election.

title: 'With open relationships, I realized that I no longer wanted to belong to anyone'
summary: 'First Times': Pivotal moments during the transition to adulthood. This week, 23-year-old Ninon (first name changed), who has been in an open relationship for almost two years, describes how she discovered this new form of love.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Israeli army keeps Palestinian reporters in their line of sights
summary: The International Federation of Journalists is accusing Israel's troops of 'deliberately targeting' media professionals working in the Gaza Strip. More than 60 journalists have been killed since the start of the conflict on October 7.

title: Senegal: Opposition figure Karim Wade files for presidential run
summary: The son of former president Abdoulaye Wade filed paperwork for the February election.

title: Suspect arrested after theft of Bansky stop sign
summary: London police arrested a man in his 20s after video on social media showed the theft of a stop sign by street artist Banksy hours after it was put up.

title: UN demands more aid for Gaza, but no truce
summary: Five days of tense negotiations were necessary to prevent another veto from the United States, which opposed calling for a 'cessation of hostilities.'

title: In Central America, a press freedom crisis is quietly unfolding
summary: Faced with attacks from authoritarian regimes, journalists in the region are trying to organize to counter the rampant exile into which they are being forced. New methods of investigation and sharing information are emerging.

title: What's in France's controversial immigration law?
summary: Parliament adopted on Tuesday night a law on immigration that was described as an 'ideological victory' by far-right leader Marine Le Pen.

title: 'In Africa, no one understands France's policy anymore'
summary: For MP Bruno Fuchs, the author of a parliamentary report on the state of Franco-African relations along with Michèle Talbot, Paris needs to move away from an outdated missionary and moralizing vision.

title: US 'deeply concerned' over fate of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny
summary: His lawyers have not had contact with him for over two weeks.

title: China's solo mothers talk about their tough journey to motherhood: 'I can live without being married, but not without having children'
summary: 'Parenting abroad.' Each week, one of our overseas journalists explores parenthood beyond our borders. In China, laws and attitudes are changing, and some women are choosing to raise their children alone. But medically assisted reproduction is reserved for married couples, forcing single people to resort to clinics abroad.

title: Japan's unique relationship with Judaism
summary: It wasn't until 1854 that the first Jews settled in the archipelago. Despite Japan's alliance with Nazi Germany, anti-Semitism did not appear in popular writings until the 1970s, a trend that has continued ever since.

title: Is sleeping in front of the TV the new stage of wakefulness?
summary: Our columnist suffers from 'chronic cathodic narcolepsy.' The opening scenes of the movies and series he manages to watch all convey a vague anxiety about the future of humanity. These repeated fictional warnings end up dulling our ability to react to reality.

title: War in Ukraine puts Russia on the defensive in the post-Soviet space
summary: Since Russia's invasion of Ukraine, former Soviet republics have been asserting their sovereignty and rapprochement with Europe is gathering pace, but the spectre of Russia remains.

title: Pentagon says drone that hit tanker ship off India was 'fired from Iran'
summary: A maritime security company says the tanker was 'Israel-affiliated' and had been on its way from Saudi Arabia to India.

title: Three local recipes for Christmas
summary: Foie gras, capon, Yule log... For this selection, local produce is best, and meat eaters will not be short-changed.

title: Le Monde in English's gifts you can't buy
summary: The best gifts don't need to have a price tag. They can be about the time, thought, and love you put into them – which can also lower their carbon footprint.

title: Turkey targets 'terrorists' in Iraq and Syria after 12 soldiers killed
summary: The soldiers were killed in attacks that targeted Turkish bases located in northern Iraq.
